reviewText: *It's a rare anime feature that moves me to rate it with the lowest marks possible, but this one accomplished the once-thought impossible!The premise sounds intriguing enough: A girl left orphaned after the double homicide of her parents is taken in (in more ways than one) by a couple of psychos with vigilante desires who groom her to become their instrument of assassination. Their targets tend to be high-profile members of society & public figures who have a tendency to stay just enough out of reach of the law to prevent being legally apprehended and paying the necessary penalties for their criminal misdeeds (child sexual abuse and related activities being high on their list). But suspicion mounts that she may be just being manipulated like a puppet and that the people she's being instructed to kill (all men, of course) may not necessarily be everything she is being informed that they are.Unfortunately, the execution (no pun intended) of the story & action, the lack of character development, the limited (almost non-existent) background & motivational information on the girl's "mentor(s)", the totally contrived plot devices, and the highly & irritatingly irrational action sequences (extremely absurd even by typical "anime" standards) makes this feature-length OAV the biggest animation TURKEY I have ever had the privilege(?) of viewing. Even the (very lame) "fan service" scenes cannot make up for its lack of interesting story and action. (Apparently, this is not the true "unrated" version as indicated, since reviewers make references to more graphic & disturbing "hentai" scenes. Still doesn't change my opinion of the whole thing, however.) Okay, I'll admit that it scores a couple of minor points for its visuals & animation, but that's about the only thing of any material substance I can come away with from this loser. In essence, if anime features were rides at the carnival, "KITE" would be the merry-go-round -- without any accompanying lights or music.Normally, something clocking in at only 45 minutes would get a point for "fair consideration" from me because of the feature's not being given enough time to really allow an indepth story to unfold (e.g., "PLASTIC LITTLE," which I actually like, despite its oversaturation of needless "fan service" which serves no purpose), but I give NO such consideration for "KITE" -- I believe that any additional amount of time given to this animated drama would have made it only that much worse than it already is.Not an outright "zero-stars" junker, but I cannot in all good conscience rate it anything higher than a "one-and-a-half" at best.
summary: OUCH!!! ...And I thought "ARMITAGE III" was bad!

Very good to get the idea of the story, with some pretty good violence left in, but wait for the hentai version.  There are some scenes that hint at some good stuff taken out.

reviewText: Kite is in one word awsome! The story line is incredible and the animation is great. A young girl arrives home one day to find her parents murdered. She is taken in by the investigating officer who takes advantage of her. He  then trains her to become assassin killing those the law can not touch. Yet  when the young assassin meet young boy in the same line of work she is in  questions about her profession and those she trusts soon rise. This is a  ultra violent film that while it is only about an hour long is still one of  the better titles you will be able to get your hands on. It should also be  mentioned that the mature conent of the young girl and her new found  gaurdian's relationship is handled with taste, not with trash like Golgo  13:Queen Bee. For those of you looking for a hard core action film with an  ending that will certainly stun you then you need look no farther. In all  fainess I must also say that this film is much better than the  "Professional" but not quite as dramatic or intense as "La  Femme Nikita".
Title: N/A

reviewText: As I'm not a huge fan of going beyond what is right, I found Kite a little difficult to watch. It contains not only excessive violence, but also rape and strong sexual situations without ever truly explaining its reasons. In many ways, all this movie was are those two things, as the story always seemed to push itself as quickly as possible toward sex or violence. Its one saving grace (at least the one that kept me watching) is its animation, which was done to near perfection. It also has a surpising ending.Note: There is an edited version for those of you who don't like strong sexual situations in their anime.

reviewText: Everytime I think I am a mature anime viewer, I rent something someone 'suggests' to me, and am bowled over.  I was in BestBuy and a dude suggested I watch Kite, since I liked NScroll and VHD, though Kite is nothing along those lines. He asked if I'd seen Wicked City, I said 'Yeah I love that'.  He said well then you'll love Kite, you're a girl and you like Henche movies.  I said what?? Henche movies, what are those?  He wrote down this website and said lookup these movie clips and rent Kite; she was so Bada>>ss...Though the ending the very very ending made me angry I loved the characters even the baddies.  Her cohort in the film is also an orphan vigilante working for the crooked cops as is she. They develop a strange kinship in the film that directs Kite's actions into the climax. I didn't see the DVD but the animation on the VHS was quite rich and colorful, dubbing was good, and voice-acting on point.  I only wish it were longer.
Title: N/A

reviewText: [Cut version]The cut version of this anime is decent... the plot is kind of interested, a molested girl, school girl by day killer at night with some kick butt action sequences and supurb animation.I suppose one of a few of the major flaws in the production would be the bad guys... they aren't really all that interesting; neither is the technological aspects of this assassin group, so much so they don't really earn the title of "assassin" group in my mind and instead seem like low budget killers. And yet Sawa defies this, she downright rocks as does Obari,The cut version of this film is interesting if you like films like The Professional and the like and is most certainly worth the rent - if you can get it for a decent price, it might just be worth buying as well (I found myself heavily enthralled with the concepts though the delivery, again, was poor especially with silly enemies... the story is really about the main characters).The rating I gave this film is for the uncut version because that is the version that was intended to be released - the cut version was meant for clean sales on sites like these selling anime movies as well as to the general (mature) public. The uncut is the film the way it was meant to be... for good or ill.[Uncut version]As I said earlier, the story is about the main characters and if you are going to appreciate Kite in all of its magnificent (or cruel) glory, then this is the version I must recommend you buy OVER the cut version.If you like Hentai you might be slightly disappointed to know that there isn't much sex in this film: however if you are more interested in a good story mixed with some sex scenes, this is perfect.Sure people complain left and right about the child molestation, but the truth is that theme is high in hardcore ecchi productions like Cool Devices and the like... so most people getting into the movie will likely be informed H-viewers who decided to see the film for similar reasons. I'm not agreeing or disagreeing that it's disgusting, but proper viewing of this film requires you to experience it with the molestation attached.Thankfully the ecchi level of the film isn't high - they are standard vaginal rape scenes with a bit of fellatio mixed in - of course they are scenes involve underage individuals. For those of you who do watch such films of the genre you'll know this isn't exactly "ecchi high" as far as Hentai goes, and here serves only to enhance the story... again, for good or bad (after all Princess 69 of the genre disturbingly features extremely young girls doing a myriad of disgusting things - believe me, for a film categorized in the same genre, this is a masterpiece as far as they are concerned).Upon watching the uncut version of the film (having some experience watching Hentai in the past), I was deeply impressed with the amount of story attached to the movie. Typically in these types of films you very rarely see a good story, or characters you can really love.The story is about a child who was taken from her mother and father, raped, and then forced into a life of an assassin (whereby she is raped repeatedly and seemingly cares little for it). As time passes she opens up to another character - Obari - and tells him how her philosophy is to live life for the moment and care little about the future (since of course has no control over her future... ironically as the vivid rape scenes depict, she has little control over the present either).There are a few things with this uncut version which annoyed me. Since most of the individuals purchasing the uncut version of the film wanted to purchase a Hentai film, Sawa is depicted at times as enjoying the sex... certainly in the beginning, that to me doesn't flow with the fact that she was being forced into living a life she couldn't control. However it does make some sense, she isn't smiling at all... in fact, she does very little smiling, she's simply letting it happen, moaning. To me, her passive enjoyment and lack of emotions throughout the first half of the movie (before she speaks with Obari) strikes me as sad: if it wasn't stressed to produce a Hentai film that Hentai fans would love so much, perhaps then would could have seen more of her emotions early on. Just a theory though.[General notes]The music throughout the film is superb - jazz music lights the mood as neither happy nor sad, and does well to (as strange as it may sound) set the film up for future viewing by generations to come (the music is timeless so to speak, good and timeless).The film is a good one, but it isn't great, again there could have been a lot more... I half hoped for the film to go on an extra hour so I could see Sawa slaughter a few more "targets" with her exploding gun. But in the end the film left on a rather unfinished note.One last pro was the fact that the movie, although leaving on an unfinished note, had the viewer emotionally hooked (especially in the uncut version) - without a solid chain of events within the story (such as better "bad guy" killings and the like), it came across as surprising how well the director established emotional bonds throughout the film.This film scores a 4/5 for having its main plot device (an assassin hired to kill individuals) only half developed in my opinion, more effort could have been made to make it more interesting. Good stuff though!
summary: Good film, uncut is a MUST though!

reviewText: This anime was billed as being like a cross of La Femme Nakita and The Professional. I suppose, in a very loose sense, it is.While the artwork is top notch, the story is devoid of any real emotion, the action scenes border on the ridiculous for an anime that's supposed to be "realistic", and there are no real efforts to make the characters appealing in any way or form.Do yourself a favor, skip this title. This is not worth the effort. If not for the artwork, it would have no redeeming qualities whatsoever.
summary: It Take More Than Pretty Girls to Make Good Anime

reviewText: This was absolutley the WORST anime I have EVER seen!  The plot was alright, but the animation was sooooooooo bad, it looked like a 5 year old did it! I may be slightly exagerating, but this movie could really use a  beat down. I don't know how the previous people who reviewed this before me  could find this anime even slightly interesting. The blood was so cheesy  and I just couldn't stand the action scenes. Everything was just so  horrible. I love japanese anime, I love all types of classics from Akira  and Ghost in the Shell, to Chronicles of the Heroic Knight, but this really  takes the cake! Most possibly the worst anime I've ever seen. I wish I  could give this a negative one. Finally, don't waste your money on this  worthless title.

reviewText: I was very anxious to see the Uncut version of Kite, or kee-tay as I called it, and I finally manage to see that Anime, but when I see the entire movie...man, it was very hard to explain.  First off, the plot is very questionable, this movie has got to be the first I've ever seen that deals with a lot of...'DEPTH'. There are still many things in this movie that I still don't understand:  What's the real reason that Akai wants Sawa to assasinate certain innocent people, why can Sawa just have the heart to decide not to kill those people and find a solution to that, and mainly, why Akai killed Sawa's parents?  There are many more questions unanswered, but I don't want to spoil it to the people, all I can say is that none of this makes sense, except for the fact that Akai is a perverted, child-raping nutcase! The animation and characters in this anime is good, but not at a same level as 'Ghost In The Shell', and everything else..just forget it!Overall...this is very hard to give the final result for 'Kite' uncensored.  I watched it so many times, and this whole excessive-meaningless gory violence and the whole child pornography of this Anime still doesn't help me understand this.  For now, I give this 2 stars, because...well I don't know.  This movie is just too much for me.

reviewText: when the print says "Absolutely not for children" they weren't joking around!  I'm an adult so the gratuotis sex/rape scenes didn't really bother me.  It actually played a part in the movie so it wasn't neccessarily random and pointless that the makers included those scenes.  The action is decent and the Sawa reminds me of Matilda in the movie Leon: The Professional.  Clocking in at 60 minutes it was all so short.  if it was longer and more to it I would definately vote it 5 stars.  I'm glad it's part of my collection none the less.  The flashbacks help tell the story of the characters and allow the viewer to follw the movie easily.  I'm glad the ending left off like it did.  It's good to see that not all films end on a positive happy go lucky tip.  In a way it was a new beginning for Sawa which was a positive in itself. Length of movie was the biggest minus i can think of.  Not for the faint of heart!  Recommended. B+

reviewText: If you know la Femme Nikita, you kind of know this story.  In this case, it's a young girl whose parents are murdered.  The investigating detective takes her under his wing and uses her as an instrument of vengence against the criminal element.  That's it in a nutshell, but the detective is no nice guy.  The story takes an implausible turn a little later on with the relationship between her and the detective, but other than that it's a great OVA with a sad ending.It's pretty bloody too, so don't watch it if yo have a weak stomach.
summary: A very nice OVA with a somewhat familiar story

reviewText: This is an anime from the late 90's so it goes without saying that the animation quality isn't up to today's standards. However, the story and action are outstanding. Kite centers on a teenage girl who is brainwashed into assassinating targets of a dirty police detective, and when I say dirty I mean dirty in every sense of the word. This is hentai, or Japanese kink, with a plot.In a lot of ways, this film bares striking similarities to Takashi Miike's Ichi the Killer. Both involve emotionally traumatized individuals being manipulated by those with dubious agendas. And both  have a lot of sex, which seems to be a trademark with Japanese filmmakers who don't have the hangups we do over here in America. Guess that's why I like Japanimation, hee, hee, hee.But I do want to stress that this is definitely not kid's stuff or suitable for a lot of grownups for that matter. Pretty touchy stuff here, including pedophilia. But the action is off the chain, in fact, better than what you'll see in most live action movies made on this side of the pond. Umetsu is one of those borderline directors: he could be "great" if he wanted to, but he's too much of a rebel, too Japanese, and not willing to compromise to appeal to mainstream audiences over here. That's a good thing to me.This is one to buy for sure. Wish they still made anime like this. RIP.
Title: N/A

reviewText: At first, "Kite" appears to be a cyber-punk action anime, with plenty of brutal assassinations. However, with four graphic sex scenes, it's clear that "Kite" would cause quite a stir among American audiences.But anime viewers can't look away--"Kite" is a gripping story of a girl trying to escape the sexual grasp of her captors.The tale centers around Sawa, a girl packing both regular and explosive bullets in her pistol, as well as miniature time bombs. She's an assassin who kills people for the male police officers who "adopted" her. Actually, they killed her parents. And they keep her for their own sexual pleasure and to kill other wanted criminals.Sawa's world is frightening, portrayed by grotesque sex scenes, in which her captors rape her if she makes a single mistake. While American audiences understandably would want to censor it, "Kite" is one of those dark films that shouldn't be censored.Certainly, "Kite" can easily be seen as a no-holds-barred post-war depiction of the sexual prostitution and injustice which took place after World War II. The film is an even sharper criticism of sexual violence in general. Anime fans will be frightened as Sawa struggles to survive against some of the most dangerous bodyguards in one of her jobs. However, Sawa finds a way to liberate herself, even if only for a short moment.The final resolution is even more antagonistic--showing that Sawa is not the only female assassin under the control of masochistic officers. "Kite" is a picture-perfect depiction of injustice within criminal enforcement. And even though this version of "Kite" is somewhat censored, it still is an excellent film revealing the problems of post-war Japan.

reviewText: Ok, there's about 3 different US versions out there and 2 japanese version as well.  Interesting enough the 2 part OVA series in japan contains rape scenes and objectional scenes of Sowa as a little (7-12yrs old) girl being seduced by Mr. Akai.  So this series is not for the light hearted, considering theres alot of un-remorseful violence and other objectional material. In light of all this the DVD version and a VHS version (brought to the US by a company called MediaBlaster) have cut out a lot of stuff, mainly the acts of rape and the little girl scenes.  There is one US VHS version by Kittymedia (mediablaster's dirty subsidiary) that releases a version that contains everything except the little girlie scenes(due to the US's child porn laws).Anyhow, some people say this distracts from the creators original intent to build up the characters.  Thats a big load of whatever, this "Movie/Series" is only 45 minutes and moves at the speed of light.  Character development is a consideration if this thing would of been 2 hours long, but the fact remains you know enough about the characters to just understand how they feel and what the movies about.  Basically this movie has no filler what-so-ever.  Its just a killer movie(literally) thats fun to watch and enjoy.  Oh yeah, the ending is very very unique.So don't waste your time finding the right unedited version, I own both the edited DVD and the Kittymedia VHS version, the rape scenes are distracting and so out of place that it actually pulls attention from the awesome action sequences in this movie. If you want a porno, get a porno, if you want one heck of a cool anime, get Kite on DVD.
summary: Alot of versions out there.....doesnt matter!!

reviewText: After watching this new version of Kite my first impression toward it was of admiration and atonishment.I saw the heavy edited version and it was an strong anime but too short.This LESS EDITED version of Kite is absolutedly different and even though it's for a more mature audience only it doesn't mean it's an anime that doesn't deserves to be recognize.People should know that this new DVD is still edited due to some graphic ..scenes involving child ponography.Some scenes are still missing but it doesn't make a big difference.Adding more scenes to the movie helped us understand more from it,the control Akai had over Sawa.Even though it's more like a "Hentai" anime and the violence is overused Kite managed to get the attention of fans once again.It's an anime with a beautiful and smooth animation and character desings.The story does develops very fast which makes it interesting to watch.The violence scenes are a little strong and bloody,not many people will feel very confortable watching it.The voices(Although I prefer watching the Japanese version)are cool.The actors did made a good job here.Some viewersI repeat,might not feel very confortable watching this anime even if you watched the edited version this one is twice strong.

reviewText: The only thing that I have to say about this film is it is perfect in every way except one.  The characters, the plotline, the action, and the unbeleivably superb animation (Makes Ghost in the Shell look like  DragonballZ).  But, like many anime films it needs to be longer.  It needs  at least an hour longer.  Perhaps include more in depth flashbacks in order  to build a stronger foundation for Sawa's motivation in the story.  Oburi  also needs a past in the movie other than a seventy second description.  The dark and perpetual ending although powerful, comes way too quickly.  Nevertheless, I strongly recommend that you see it.

reviewText: I'm so tired of hearing bad things about this anime, like bad character developement, bad story, too violent, hentai, whatever.This story is really not as straiforward as it seems,  why else would the ending be so confusing to some. In my opinion there is also a lot of character devepement. Sawa was young and terrified when her parents were killed. The detective guy raped her at this time when she was most vulnerable and took her in. We know he then trained her to be a killer but I believe the anime does a wonderful job explaining how she succumbed to it.It actually reminds me of that old South Park episode where the volcano erupted while Stan's uncle Jim was taking the kids hunting. When it was Stan's turn to shoot, he aimed at the rabbit and then was like, "I don't want to kill the bunny" and it escaped and everyone got angry. At the end he finally ends up killing something for the sake of being accepted even though it was against his nature.Sawa is the same. Her face is always sad and she doen't like what she is doing. She's young and impressionable and doesn't have the mental strenth and confidence to get away. This is why I find the story so touching. It's really very sad.Oh yeah and about the violence, Maybe it is a littleexcessive but I thought the fight seens were absolutely awesome. I mean, a lot of anime is violent with teh whole neon pink blood thing happening so what's the problem?The sex though is a bit extreme. In a way, it better explains Sawa's situation and how she came to be tied to that detective guy. She doesn't have the strength to fight it (mentally that is since it is sooo obvious she's a great assasin). If u're that offended by graphic sex (there is a lot) then just watch the edited version. I didn't think it was all that bad. Actually the sex was almost what probably what made so many women not like the movie so the edited version is better for us females. Guys i'm sure don't mind so PLEASE see this movie with an open mind and actually listen to everything they say.THIS IS A GOOD MOVIE!!
summary: THIS IS A GOOD ANIME IF U UNDERSTAND IT!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Somewhere along the way, the writers of KITE lost all remaining sense of direction, got boozed up and decided to go with whatever they had in the morning. What started with a script of Luc Besson's 'La Femme Nikita' ended up being one of the most uninspired and dumbest pieces of crap ever made. Halfway through, you can't help but think this conversation took place:--Writer: "Uh, sir, to tell you the truth, I have no idea where I'm going with the script, and the plot so far has no redeeming value whatsoever."Boss: "Add sex scenes."Writer: "Maybe if I add some character development and--"Boss: "SEX SCENES!!"--Sawa is just a regular cute Japanese teenage girl. (sounds original already, doesn't it?) The thing is, if it seems like she's coming on to you, she's probably getting ready to shoot you in the head with an exploding bullet. Don't feel bad, though, it's nothing personal. She and a male assasin named Oburi-- who English voice actors pronounce "Ovary" for some inexplicable reason (something I don't believe is a coincidence... I thought there was something strange about that guy)-- systematically kill people who their employer decides are evil.The voice acting is laughable at times in the English dub ("I like teeeeaaaa. Stroooooong greeeeeeeen teeeeeeaaa."). Monotony and raspy voices is the game here, apperantly. The script is not awe-inspiring, either ("Impressive, my cute little assassin. Too bad you're going to die ugly."). In fact, just about everything in this movie in subpar.The ending is the epitome of all copped-out (not to mention inane) movie endings. Just why the basketball girl does what she does at the end has actually caused me to lose sleep over trying to figure it out. I thought I might sound like an idiot if I didn't decipher it before posting a review, but I've come to the conclusion that even the writers had no idea... what they were doing.
summary: I like teeeeaaaa. Strooooong greeeeean teeeeeaa.

reviewText: I really liked this movie. As I watched it I was really getting into the story and the characters. The artwork is beautiful and some of the action scenes are incredible. But just when it starts to get really good the movie is over. This movie needed at least another hour to fully develop the plot and characters. There's a little love story between the girl and a murderous young guy but it never gets explored. There's also a connection between the girl and her parents that never get explored. This story has so much more to offer but there is simply not enough time to do it in this 45min movie.

reviewText: When I first watched this movie I was new to the anime scene.  I had great expectations but was beginning to get discouraged by anticlimactic endings.  I am sorry to say that this was one of those movies that added to that.  Kite starts off great with action and some forshadowing, I was really getting into the story.  Yet it almost seemed as if right where the story should have introduced some character development, confusion and more action was put in its place.Though, this movie has its downfalls, take the time to check it out at least for the nice animation and interesting fight scenes.  Kite is worth borrowing from a friend or renting but I wouldn't suggest buying it yourself.

reviewText: I usually like a little darkness in anime shows; however the uncut version was just a bit too much. Frankly if you get a kick out of men taking advantage of young girls, don't hesitate to check it out. The movie was about a young girl who gets tricked into working for the very man who killed her family. She is trained to be a killer by her family's murderer and goes around killing people. She meets up with another guy assasin who is closer to her age; and of course, they fall in love. Then of course, she is supposed to kill him. In the end they both get revenge on the bad guys; but, like all anime, there is that little twist in the end. Blah, blah blah.This movie left me feeling dirty and depressed. For anyone who gets their kicks out of sick shows and love being shocked, this is your movie. If you would rather watch a show that has some darkness, but yet some deep meaning, watch "Now and Then, Here and There", "Hellsing", or "Battle Angel". At least there is some discretion used in these movies and series.

reviewText: Last night i sat through kite. I was not overly impressed with the production of the DVD itself. For a recently new production, i felt they could have done more with the special features aspect of the DVD.Well, I really liked Kite. Perhaps i liked it right away because I really enjoyed Le Femme Nikkita (french version) and loved "Leon, the Professional." Extreme Graphic Violence is right!! I was dying to know what that meant, considering I had seen "Ninja Scroll" with only a "Graphic Violence" warning. Because of the Bilingual feature available to the DVD, I chose to watch it dubbed in english. The artwork is really different from what i am used to, but became really enjoyable after about 10 minutes. The English Voice Acting is nothing to shake an award at however.For something i expected to be predictable from the start, "Kite" does an excellent job of confusing and misleading the viewer. I really should watch it again in Japanese before i write a fair opinion for "Kite," after all, it is only 45 minutes !!I did not mind watching a censored version of this film at all. I don't mind sex and nudity in a film, but adolescant rape scenes don't interest me one bit. I just wish that if they were to edit out that much film, that a new release would have contained other scenes to lengthen it out a little bit. I guess if you watch it in english, and then immediatley in japanese, you have yourself a 90 minute full length featureWithout a doubt, this is an Adult oriented anime. Be it do to the very brief nudity, sexual undertones, and very graphic violence, this is not a toy for the kiddies. I do appreciate the idea of Anime for adults, and this was done very well.very good
Title: N/A

reviewText: i bought this version cause i had seen the censored cut version before and it was good but very confusing cause the missing sexual things to it.now i bought this version cause it was supposed to have all those missing things to it.guess again folks,it may say the director's cut.but it was not what it said it was.it turned out to be the exact same one i had seen which was the censored version.leaving me very disappointed with it i decided to give it to my brother.so, if you want it uncut and uncensored then go for the actual uncut version.don't be fooled like i was by getting the director's cut cause there is nothing new to it,it's just the censored release all over again.waste of time and money.
summary: kite the director's cut,don't you believe it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Other than the fact that this anime was censored in numerous places, Kite's pretty enjoyable. You have your assassins with messed up pasts, sweet over-the-top gunfights, and bloody messes. And, to set this anime apart from others, you have exploding bullets, vehicles that fall through numerous floors, many cats, an exploding basketball, and the best part, the ridiculously long (and messy) public restroom gunfight. Would you expect all of this mayhem to be accompanied with a soundtrack done entirely with a peppy saxophone? Well, that's what it is, and it just doesn't fit. This anime is cut in many places and the dialogue is edited a bit to cover the missing scenes up. A director's cut version is available in Europe, so buy it if it ever comes here.
summary: Good, but don't buy this. Wait for the uncut.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There are so many movies out there that have the POTENTIAL of being so much better... I think this is NOT one of them, though it may have seemed to in the opening scene (the emotionless girl wasting someone with her handy hand-gun, hops off a building rooftop into the mist of the city in an almost graceful, superhero fashion).  However, the end result of this film is an edited sex movie that has a bunch of extremely violent scenes linked together by what?  I'm not sure, but the numbness of the characters pretty much coincides with the numbness of the viewer.  Though I did enjoy the gun-to-gun combat (vs. hand-to-hand) scene in the subway near the end (almost like The Matrix, but more over-the-top), it's not worth it to keep... I sold this one after buying it... you decide.  If you want bloody action for the sake of cool bloody action, ok, you've got it.
summary: Can the action sequences SAVE it??
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you like extreme graphic violence (a la Ninja Scroll, etc), then you'll want to watch this one. No doubt about it.But the storyline of the anime left me unsatisfied in many respects.For one thing, the main character Sawa is working as a vigilante assassin under Akai's command, but she doesn't like it. So my question is, why the heck doesn't she just quit??? I mean, considering the stuff she has to endure and the stuff she knows, I don't know what binds Sawa to Mr. Akai to do his bidding.Secondly, the anime seems heavily edited (i.e. censored). There are several occassions where the screen simply goes into a freeze-frame for several seconds (complete with the tell-tale screen jitter). Other reviewers here wrote that these cut scenes involve VERY explicit sex scenes, some involving Sawa. Since Sawa is a high-school girl (just look at her school uniform), not a college girl like the DVD says, cutting away those scenes probably meant cutting away "graphic sex with a minor" element, a definite no-no in American marketing point of view.So it's understandable, but I don't really like it. Perhaps those missing scenes would have shed a better light on Sawa's character. Maybe it'll have shown Sawa's submissive side to Akai, explaining my aforementioned question of "why doesn't she just quit?" Who knows.All in all, it's a nice anime. The animation quality is just mediocre, but the music is quite nice, and overall the anime has a nice "feel" to it. Many of the action sequences (and the violence therein) are utterly cool, and I loved the ending. Unexpected, but fitting.Being something of a purist myself, however, I can't help but wish that the totally uncut version was on the DVD. It's frustrating to know that you're not being given the whole picture, you know?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Most of the summaries that I have seen regarding this anime go something like this when talking about the main character; Sawa appears to be an attractive, innocent, and naivee college student on the surface but is a  cold-blooded killer.  So when I bought this tape I was expecting to see a  story about a professional assassin with the perfect cover.  This however  is not the case.  Sawa is by no stretch of the imagination any kind of  professional assassin.  She is instead an extremely lucky, clumsy amateur  assassin.  I say amateur because her technique is sloopy, she made several  stupid mistakes when it came to attempting to assassinate a target, and I  do not honestly believe that she had the kind of skills need to prevent the  sort of injuries that she recieved from her carelessness.  The mistakes  that she made was leaving traceable evidence, and letting her guard down  way to easy.  What kind of assassin is really that careless?  Maybe I  should really say a good assassin wouldn't be that careless.I was also  expecting Sawa to be one touch chick (like Angel from Angel Cop), but she  wasn't tough at all.  She was instead a naivee, dependent, sad, abused  little girl trapped inside of a woman's body.  I felt really sorry for her.  The other assassin that she met seemed to have a much better technique and  better skills.  But he also had his share of flaws, because just like Sawa  he was naivee, and let his guard down way too easy for someone in his  profession.  I hear that this movie has been cut.  I would like to see what  they took out just so I'd experience the anime the way that the creator had  intended.The action sequences weren't all that great, but then again  most Japanime action stuff involving guns (such as Cop stuff, assassin  stuff) can't even begin to touch live action American movies of the same  nature.  So I think that this is important to keep in mind when viewing  this.  Also one of the action sequences was so far beyond the realm of  believeablity that it takes away part of the seriousness needed in a film  of this nature.
Title: N/A
